013package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
014
015import java.io.IOException;
016import java.io.StreamTokenizer;
017import java.io.StringReader;
018import java.sql.SQLData;
019import java.sql.SQLException;
020import java.sql.SQLInput;
021import java.sql.SQLOutput;
022import java.util.logging.Logger;
023
024import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
025import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
026import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.BaseUDT;
027
028import static org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function.Effects.IMMUTABLE;
029import static
030    org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function.OnNullInput.RETURNS_NULL;
031
032/**
033 * Complex (re and im parts are doubles) implemented in Java as a scalar UDT.
034 */
035@SQLAction(requires = "complex assertHasValues",
036    install = {
037        "SELECT javatest.assertHasValues(" +
038        " CAST('(1,2)' AS javatest.complex), 1, 2)"
039    }
040)
041@BaseUDT(schema="javatest", name="complex",
042    internalLength=16, alignment=BaseUDT.Alignment.DOUBLE)
043public class ComplexScalar implements SQLData {
044    private static Logger s_logger = Logger.getAnonymousLogger();
045
046    /**
047     * Return the same 'complex' passed in, logging its contents at level INFO.
048     * @param cpl any instance of this UDT
049     * @return the same instance passed in
050     */
051    @Function(
052        schema="javatest", name="logcomplex", effects=IMMUTABLE,
053        onNullInput=RETURNS_NULL)
054    public static ComplexScalar logAndReturn(ComplexScalar cpl) {
055        s_logger.info(cpl.getSQLTypeName() + cpl);
056        return cpl;
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * Assert a 'complex' has given re and im values, to test that its
061     * representation in Java corresponds to what PostgreSQL sees.
062     * @param cpl an instance of this UDT
063     * @param re the 'real' value it should have
064     * @param im the 'imaginary' value it should have
065     * @throws SQLException if the values do not match
066     */
067    @Function(schema="javatest",
068        provides="complex assertHasValues",
069        effects=IMMUTABLE, onNullInput=RETURNS_NULL)
070    public static void assertHasValues(ComplexScalar cpl, double re, double im)
071        throws SQLException
072    {
073        if ( cpl.m_x != re  ||  cpl.m_y != im )
074            throw new SQLException("assertHasValues fails");
075    }
076
077    @Function(effects=IMMUTABLE, onNullInput=RETURNS_NULL)
078    public static ComplexScalar parse(String input, String typeName)
079            throws SQLException {
080        try {
081            StreamTokenizer tz = new StreamTokenizer(new StringReader(input));
082            if (tz.nextToken() == '('
083                    && tz.nextToken() == StreamTokenizer.TT_NUMBER) {
084                double x = tz.nval;
085                if (tz.nextToken() == ','
086                        && tz.nextToken() == StreamTokenizer.TT_NUMBER) {
087                    double y = tz.nval;
088                    if (tz.nextToken() == ')') {
089                        s_logger.info(typeName + " from string");
090                        return new ComplexScalar(x, y, typeName);
091                    }
092                }
093            }
094            throw new SQLException("Unable to parse complex from string \""
095                    + input + '"');
096        } catch (IOException e) {
097            throw new SQLException(e.getMessage());
098        }
099    }
100
101    private double m_x;
102
103    private double m_y;
104
105    private String m_typeName;
106
107    public ComplexScalar() {
108    }
109
110    public ComplexScalar(double x, double y, String typeName) {
111        m_x = x;
112        m_y = y;
113        m_typeName = typeName;
114    }
115
116    @Override
117    public String getSQLTypeName() {
118        return m_typeName;
119    }
120
121    @Function(effects=IMMUTABLE, onNullInput=RETURNS_NULL)
122    @Override
123    public void readSQL(SQLInput stream, String typeName) throws SQLException {
124        s_logger.info(typeName + " from SQLInput");
125        m_x = stream.readDouble();
126        m_y = stream.readDouble();
127        m_typeName = typeName;
128    }
129
130    @Function(effects=IMMUTABLE, onNullInput=RETURNS_NULL)
131    @Override
132    public String toString() {
133        s_logger.info(m_typeName + " toString");
134        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
135        sb.append('(');
136        sb.append(m_x);
137        sb.append(',');
138        sb.append(m_y);
139        sb.append(')');
140        return sb.toString();
141    }
142
143    @Function(effects=IMMUTABLE, onNullInput=RETURNS_NULL)
144    @Override
145    public void writeSQL(SQLOutput stream) throws SQLException {
146        s_logger.info(m_typeName + " to SQLOutput");
147        stream.writeDouble(m_x);
148        stream.writeDouble(m_y);
149    }
150}
